content.value:
Sometimes wonder what would‚Äôve happened to software if GitHub didn‚Äôt exist:

- Pull requests would not exist
- Most code would not be open source by default
- Harder to learn ~everything without search
- No ‚≠êÔ∏è system to skew tech choices
- Git may not have won version control

content: Many of the replies here are from people who clearly have no idea just how dominant Google Code was, or how inconvenient and terrible by today's standards, or how revolutionary an improvement on what came before. Or they live in the Linux kernel bubble and haven't left.
